entry.title: yaoi paddle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that if you went to an anime convention in the 2000s, you might have been hit by a yaoi paddle (example pictured)?

entry.title: Joe Mulbah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Liberian minister of information Joe Mulbah was suspended by President Charles Taylor after a fist fight with the deputy minister of information?

entry.title: rainwater harvesting in the Sahel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that zaï planting pits are an indigenous form of rainwater harvesting in the Sahel?

entry.title: Studio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite being marketed as Tages' international breakthrough, Studio was only issued in Sweden and Denmark upon original release?

entry.title: Barbara Kennedy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Barbara Kennedy was the first player to lead NCAA Division I women's basketball in scoring?

entry.title: Constantin Bivol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Constantin Bivol, who championed land reform in Bessarabia, could only locate half of his ten dessiatins of ancestral farmland, noting that "God only knows where the rest of them are"?

entry.title: Old Friends ... New Friends (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fred Rogers created and hosted a television documentary series titled Old Friends ... New Friends due to his concern that older generations were getting more isolated from younger generations?

entry.title: Jonathan Jacob Meijer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a court ordered Jonathan Jacob Meijer to stop donating sperm or pay a €100,000 fine per donation?
